html: The expression “your God” reasserts the covenant bond that binds Jehovah to his people (Exodus 6:7; Leviticus 26:12). Its parallel, “your Savior,” affirms that Israel’s God, not some other, is their Savior (v 11; Isaiah 45:21; 49:26; 60:16; 63:8-9). Although other saviors exist, such as Jehovah’s servant and his associates, they only qualify Jehovah’s people for salvation; they don’t themselves save them (Isaiah 19:20; 37:35; 63:9, 17; 65:8). Other peoples become a “ransom” for them when the king of Assyria/Babylon slays the nations among whom they live, thinking he slays Jehovah’s people also.
